summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 between attorneys from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP and federal prosecutors (SDNY) regarding scheduling a proffer session. The proffer is intended to provide an overview of Jeffrey Epstein's relationship with a bank, his accounts, and notable transactions, based on the bank's internal investigation and document production in response to a subpoena.

persons.name: Parvin Moyne
persons.role: Attorney at Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP
persons.context: Primary correspondent proposing and scheduling a proffer session on behalf of a bank client to guide prosecutors through financial records related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Thomas Moyer
persons.context: Copied on all email correspondence between Parvin Moyne and federal prosecutors regarding the scheduling and format of the Epstein-related bank records proffer.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the bank's internal investigation and the SDNY subpoena. The proffer aims to explain his relationship with the bank and transactions in his accounts.

connections.description: Both are attorneys involved in coordinating the bank's response to the SDNY subpoena regarding Jeffrey Epstein's financial records.
Moyne, representing a bank, is facilitating the production and explanation of financial records pertaining to Epstein's accounts and transactions.

events.title: SDNY Production Index Provided
events.description: Parvin Moyne sends an index of documents produced to the SDNY regarding Jeffrey Epstein's bank accounts, noting it is a work in progress.

events.title: Scheduling of Attorney Proffer
events.description: Email negotiations to schedule a 2-3 hour attorney proffer session to guide SDNY prosecutors through Epstein's bank relationship, accounts, and notable transactions.

locations: One Bryant Park, New York, NY 10036-6745 (Akin Gump office)
keyFacts: A bank, represented by Akin Gump attorneys, conducted an internal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's financial relationship and transactions.
The bank had produced documents to the SDNY in response to a subpoena and was offering an attorney proffer to guide prosecutors through the records.
The planned proffer aimed to provide an overview of Epstein's relationship with the bank, his accounts, transaction types, and highlight specific transactions noted in the internal investigation.
The correspondence reveals an ongoing, cooperative financial investigation by the SDNY into Epstein's banking activities in August 2019.
The email signatures and disclaimers identify Parvin Daphne Moyne as an attorney at Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP.
